skillTree.name: Warhorse
skillTree.description: While Wizards can rarely benefit from amour, a warhorse does offer some degree of protection and manoeuvrability.

effects.description: Mount: Warhorse

skillTree.name: Barded Warhorse
skillTree.description: A general's horse can be their most trusted and daring companion. Just don't name him 'Daisy'.

effects.description: Mount: Barded Warhorse

skillTree.name: Imperial Pegasus
skillTree.description: An Imperial pegasus is a noble, winged steed, intelligent and loyal.

effects.description: Mount: Imperial Pegasus

skillTree.name: Carmine Dragon
skillTree.description: Carmine Dragons are sinister, clever and deadly creatures, and considered spectres of death in many ancient tales.

effects.description: Mount: Carmine Dragon

skillTree.name: Amaranthine
skillTree.description: "What do you grow in a garden? Food! Why do you think she is always so well-fed, even during famines? What’s in her Garden?"

effects.description: Hit points: +10%
Casualty replenishment rate: +10%

skillTree.name: Embodiment of Shyish
skillTree.description: Shyish blows strongest wherever death must be faced or endings take place.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve change: +8% when increasing
	(all armies factionwide)

skillTree.name: Loremaster, Lore of Death
skillTree.description: None know better the secrets of Shyish, the Wind of Death, than those who have mastered its Lore.

effects.description: Cooldown: -25% to Lore of Death spells
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Fate of Bjuna"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Soulblight Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Purple Sun of Xereus Upgraded"
Ability: "Darkwalker"

skillTree.name: Guns of Nuln
skillTree.description: Countess von Liebwitz has granted Elspeth full access to her armoury, along with all of its cannons and other artillery pieces.

effects.description:
Range: +12% for Mortar, Great Cannon, Helblaster Voley Gun, and Helstorm Rocket Battery units
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: +10% for Mortar, Great Cannon, Helblaster Voley Gun, and Helstorm Rocket Battery units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -25% for Mortar, Great Cannon, Helblaster Voley Gun, and Helstorm Rocket Battery units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Spectre of Death
skillTree.description: It is not uncommon to see Elspeth appear like a spectre of death itself, gowned in robes so black as to appear as living darkness and bearing a keening scythe so sharp it seemed to murder the still air.

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 when in own or allied territory
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 when in own or allied territory
	(Lord's army)
Wound recovery time: -4

skillTree.name: The Graveyard Rose
skillTree.description: Stories of the 'Graveyard Rose' have been used to frighten recalcitrant children home before nightfall lest 'the dark lady snatch them up!'. Yet despite these stories few have ever paused to think what exactly the admitted presence of von Draken in the city actually means, and fewer yet could guess at her true power or influence.

effects.description:
Enemy casualty replenishment rate: -8%
	(local region)
Campaign movement range: +12%

Corruption: -4
	(local province)

skillTree.name: Friends in High Places
skillTree.description: Von Draken is a true scion of the Empire, and the bane of its foes where they cross her path. She also has long standing pacts and alliances both with the Church of Morr and the ruling council of Nuln to come to its aid in times of war in return for their alliance in turn.

effects.description:
Control: +1
	(all provinces)
Income from trade tariffs: +10%
Diplomatic relations: +15 with the Empire, Kislev, Southern Realms and Bretonnia

skillTree.name: Dark Lady of Nuln
skillTree.description: The truth is that Elspeth von Draken is but one in a long bloodline touched by the winds of magic, a bloodline that has produced both monsters and saviours in its time. She is also one of the most powerful Amethyst wizards of the age, but one who will have little to do with the daily machinations or power-politics of the Imperial Colleges of Magic in which she was once student and still in theory holds fealty.

effects.description: A Wizard Lord will be made available for recruitment via the Colleges of Magic panel

skillTree.name: Earthing
skillTree.description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -15%

skillTree.name: Magical Reserves
skillTree.description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5
Spell: "The Fate of Bjuna"

ui_effects.description: Strong vs 25 men unit or above

skillTree.name: Inspiring Presence
skillTree.description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)
Character's aura leadership effect: +5

skillTree.name: Emperor's Finest
skillTree.description: “We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Spearmen, Swordsmen, Flagellants, and Halberdiers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Speed of Horse
skillTree.description: These steeds are bred for speed and war, but foremost it is their gallop which marks them out.

Charge bonus: +6 for Empire Knights, Reiksguard, and Knights of the Blazing Sun units

skillTree.name: Pistolkorps
skillTree.description: This Lord expects his men to practice the disciplines of the Pistolkorps, and all be expert marksmen.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +4% for Free Company Militia, Crossbowmen, Huntsmen, Archers, Handgunners, Pistoliers and Outriders units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +10% for Free Company Militia, Crossbowmen, Huntsmen, Archers, Handgunners, Pistoliers and Outriders missile units

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Honest Steel
skillTree.description: Honest Empire-forged steel is all a state trooper could ask when confronting the myriad foes in battle.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +6% for Greatswords and Demigryph Knights units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +6 for Greatswords and Demigryph Knights units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Greatswords and Demigryph Knights units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Mighty Forge
skillTree.description: Patrons of great forges and smiths expect, and are rewarded with, tougher and more enduring war machines.

Ward save: 7% for War Wagon, Steam Tank and Luminark of Hysh units

skillTree.name: Imperial Gunnery
skillTree.description: Despite what the Dwarfs think, no other race can bring to bear such devastating artillery volleys.

Missile strength: +4% for Mortar, Great Cannon, Helblaster Voley Gun, and Helstorm Rocket Battery units

	(Lord's army)
Ability: "Rally!"

skillTree.name: Strength of Hardship
skillTree.description: The frontline will either make or break you. Those who survive become the backbone of any army.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Spearmen, Swordsmen, Flagellants, Huntsmen and Empire Knights units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Spearmen, Swordsmen, Flagellants, Huntsmen and Empire Knights units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 15% for Spearmen, Swordsmen, Flagellants, Huntsmen and Empire Knights units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Sharpshooter
skillTree.description: The veteran marksman knows the precise range required to land the killing shot.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +12% for Free Company Militia, Crossbowmen, Huntsmen, Archers, Handgunners, Pistoliers and Outriders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Taste for Battle
skillTree.description: Some men grow to relish war, dulled to the pain and living solely for the thrill of the kill.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Greatswords, Halberdiers, Reiksguard, Knights of the Blazing Sun, and Demigryph Knights units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.name: Artillery Master
skillTree.description: Those in command of ordnance can potentially decide a battle before the melee has even begun.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +20% for Mortar, Great Cannon, Helblaster Volley Gun, Helstorm Rocket Battery, War Wagon, Luminark of Hysh and Steam Tank units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.name: Route Marcher
skillTree.description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +5%

skillTree.name: Scholar
skillTree.description: Far removed from the petty squabbles of other ones, many wizard lords are able to devote themselves to learning, magic and the arts.

Research rate: +5%

skillTree.description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.

skillTree.name: Reassuring Presence
skillTree.description: The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

skillTree.name: Fleeting Shadow
skillTree.description: Knowing precisely where and when to launch an ambush, and against who, takes an unusual level of guile.

skillTree.name: Magisterix
skillTree.description: The Amethyst Order is among the most introverted of the Orders of Magic. After the Shadowmancers, the Brethren of Shyish is the most successfully secretive organisation in the Empire. This serves to increase the public’s already considerable fear of Shyish’s Magisters.

effects.description: Construction cost: -40% for Battle Wizard recruitment buildings

Hero recruit rank: +4 for Battle Wizards
	(factionwide)

skillTree.name: Lightning Strike
skillTree.description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enemy battle reinforcement time: +25%
Enemy battle reinforcement time: +50%
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Enemy battle reinforcement time: +50%

skillTree.name: Quartermaster
skillTree.description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.

backgroundSkills.name: Arch-Wizard of Amethyst Order
backgroundSkills.description: For three generations the name of Elspeth von Draken, the Dark Lady of Nuln, Magisterix of the Amethyst Order and arch-wizard of the Lore of Death, has been spoken of in hushed tones in the reeking tavern gutters and vaulted noble halls of Nuln alike.
